card.name: Abyssal Horror
card.ability:
Flying
When Abyssal Horror enters the battlefield, target player discards two cards.

card.name: Air Elemental
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: As insubstantial, and as powerful, as the wind that carries it.

card.name: Alluring Scent
card.ability: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
card.flavor: No earthly armor is protection against this sweetness.

card.name: Ancient Craving
card.ability: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.
card.flavor: Knowledge demands sacrifice.

card.name: Angel of Light
card.ability: Flying, vigilance

card.name: Angel of Mercy
card.ability:
Flying
When Angel of Mercy enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

card.name: Angelic Blessing
card.ability: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: Only the warrior who can admit mortal weakness will be bolstered by immortal strength.

card.name: Archangel
card.ability: Flying, vigilance

card.name: Ardent Militia
card.ability: Vigilance
card.flavor: Some fight for honor and some for gold, but the militia fight for hearth and home.

card.name: Armageddon
card.ability: Destroy all lands.

card.name: Barbtooth Wurm
card.flavor: In its lair lies a carpet of bones.

card.name: Bargain
card.ability:
Target opponent draws a card.
You gain 7 life.
card.flavor: Bargaining with a goblin is like trading with a child; both believe they already own everything.

card.name: Blinding Light
card.ability: Tap all nonwhite creatures.
card.flavor: Let the unjust avert their faces and contemplate their peril.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Will not tap a creature that is both white and another color.

card.name: Bog Imp
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: Don't be fooled by their looks. Think of them as little knives with wings.

card.name: Bog Raiders
card.ability: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
card.flavor: Those who live amid decay must expect scavengers.

card.name: Bog Wraith
card.ability: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
card.flavor: It moved through the troops leaving no footprints, save on their souls.

card.name: Border Guard
card.flavor: "Join the army, see foreign countries" they'd said.

card.name: Breath of Life
card.ability: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

card.name: Bull Hippo
card.ability: Islandwalk
card.flavor: Stay alert: his lumbering may shake the ground itself, but in water, he glides.

card.name: Champion Lancer
card.ability: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Champion Lancer by creatures.
card.flavor: The flash of his lance projects the pure radiance of his honor.

card.name: Charging Paladin
card.ability: Whenever Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor: A true warrior's thoughts are of victory, not death.

card.name: Chorus of Woe
card.ability: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: When nightstalkers sing, nothing in creation sleeps.

card.name: Cinder Storm
card.ability: Cinder Storm deals 7 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: When the sky's rain has turned to fire, what will put it out?

card.name: Coercion
card.ability: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
card.flavor: "Human tenderness is simply weakness in a pretty package."

card.name: Coral Eel
card.flavor: Some fishers like to eat eels, and some eels like to eat fishers.

card.name: Counterspell
card.ability: Counter target spell.

card.name: Dakmor Ghoul
card.ability: When Dakmor Ghoul enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
card.flavor:
"Cursed be the sickly forms that err from honest Nature's rule"
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "Locksley Hall"

card.name: Dakmor Lancer
card.ability: When Dakmor Lancer enters the battlefield, destroy target nonblack creature.
card.flavor: The darkness of his shield reflects the inky blackness of his soul.

card.name: Dakmor Plague
card.ability: Dakmor Plague deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
card.flavor: The tiniest cough can be deadlier than the fiercest dragon.

card.name: Dakmor Scorpion
card.flavor: A scorpion this big you won't find curled up in your boot. Maybe around your boot, but not in it.

card.name: Dakmor Sorceress
card.ability: Dakmor Sorceress's power is equal to the number of Swamps you control.

card.name: Dark Offering
card.ability: Destroy target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.
card.flavor:
"Our greatest hope has become our enemy's greatest triumph."
—Court counselor

card.name: Denizen of the Deep
card.ability: When Denizen of the Deep enters the battlefield, return each other creature you control to its owner's hand.

card.name: Devastation
card.ability: Destroy all creatures and lands.
card.flavor: There is much talk about the art of creation. What about the art of destruction?

card.name: Devoted Hero
card.flavor: The heart's courage is the soul's guardian.

card.name: Devout Monk
card.ability: When Devout Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: Discipline wears many robes.

card.name: Dread Reaper
card.ability:
Flying
When Dread Reaper enters the battlefield, you lose 5 life.

card.name: Durkwood Boars
card.flavor: "And the unclean spirits went out, and entered the swine; and the herd ran violently . . . ."The Bible, Mark 5:13

card.name: Eager Cadet
card.flavor: The enthusiasm of the young, sharpened by the discipline of a soldier.

card.name: Earth Elemental
card.flavor: Its voice has the tremor of deafening thunder, its blow the force of an avalanche.

card.name: Exhaustion
card.ability: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The creatures and lands are only prevented from untapping during the targeted player's next untap step. They can still can untap during other player's untap steps.
10/1/2009 : No creatures or lands controlled by the player will untap during his or her next untap step. This includes those which entered the battlefield after Exhaustion resolved.

card.name: Extinguish
card.ability: Counter target sorcery spell.

card.name: Eye Spy
card.ability: Look at the top card of target player's library. You may put that card into his or her graveyard.

card.name: False Peace
card.ability: Target player skips all combat phases of his or her next turn.
card.flavor: Mutual consent is not required for war.

card.name: Feral Shadow
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Not all shadows are cast by light—some are cast by darkness.

card.name: Fire Elemental
card.flavor: You are drawn to your death as a moth to the flame.

card.name: Fire Tempest
card.ability: Fire Tempest deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.

card.name: Foot Soldiers
card.flavor: Infantry deployment is the art of putting your troops in the wrong place at the right time.

card.name: Gerrard's Wisdom
card.ability: You gain 2 life for each card in your hand.
card.flavor: "You'll lose a duel if your enemy comes expecting a war."

card.name: Giant Octopus
card.flavor: At the sight of the thing the calamari vendor's eyes went wide, but from fear or avarice none could tell.

card.name: Goblin Cavaliers
card.flavor: They get along so well with their goats because they're practically goats themselves.

card.name: Goblin Chariot
card.ability: Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)
card.flavor: They have to replace the wheels, they have to replace the boar, and sometimes they have to replace the goblin.

card.name: Goblin Commando
card.ability: When Goblin Commando enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature.
card.flavor: With a commando around, somebody's gonna get hurt.

card.name: Goblin General
card.ability: Whenever Goblin General attacks, Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Lead, follow, or run around like crazy.

card.name: Goblin Glider
card.ability:
Flying
Goblin Glider can't block.
card.flavor: The goblins call the gliders "death from above." Everyone else calls them "clods in the clouds."

card.name: Goblin Hero
card.flavor: When you're a goblin, you don't have to step forward to be a hero—everyone else just has to step back.

card.name: Goblin Lore
card.ability: Draw four cards, then discard three cards at random.
card.flavor:
"I done forgot more than you'll ever know, pipsqueak."
"Yeah—that's your problem."

card.name: Goblin Mountaineer
card.ability: Mountainwalk
card.flavor: Goblin mountaineer, barely keeps his family fed.

card.name: Goblin Settler
card.ability: When Goblin Settler enters the battlefield, destroy target land.
card.flavor: Be it ever so crumbled, there's no place like home.

card.name: Gorilla Warrior
card.flavor: They were formidable even before they learned the use of weapons.

card.name: Gravedigger
card.ability: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Grim Tutor
card.ability: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand, then shuffle your library. You lose 3 life.
card.flavor:
He who goes unpunished never learns.
—Greek proverb

card.name: Grizzly Bears
card.flavor: Don't worry about provoking grizzly bears; they come that way.

card.name: Hand of Death
card.ability: Destroy target nonblack creature.
card.flavor: The touch of death is never gentle.

card.name: Hollow Dogs
card.ability: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: A hollow dog is never empty. It is filled with thirst for the hunt.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If it attacks more than once per turn, it gets the bonus each time.

card.name: Howling Fury
card.ability: Target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: I howl my soul to the moon, and the moon howls with me.

card.name: Hulking Goblin
card.ability: Hulking Goblin can't block.
card.flavor: The bigger they are, the harder they avoid work.

card.name: Hulking Ogre
card.ability: Hulking Ogre can't block.
card.flavor: Once they realized the ogre had more size than speed, the soldiers simply went around it.

card.name: Ingenious Thief
card.ability:
Flying
When Ingenious Thief enters the battlefield, look at target player's hand.

card.name: Jagged Lightning
card.ability: Jagged Lightning deals 3 damage to each of two target creatures.

card.name: Knight Errant
card.flavor:
". . . Before honor is humility."
—The Bible, Proverbs 15:33

card.name: Last Chance
card.ability: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.

card.name: Lava Axe
card.ability: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.
card.flavor: Meant to cut through the body and burn straight to the soul.

card.name: Lone Wolf
card.ability: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.
4/1/2008 : When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
4/1/2008 : You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
4/1/2008 : If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

card.name: Loyal Sentry
card.ability: When Loyal Sentry blocks a creature, destroy that creature and Loyal Sentry.

card.name: Lynx
card.ability: Forestwalk
card.flavor: Rarely seen, hardly heard, never caught.

card.name: Man-o'-War
card.ability: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It can choose itself. It has to if there are no other creatures.

card.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
card.flavor: Are merfolk humans with fins, or are humans merfolk with feet?

card.name: Mind Rot
card.ability: Target player discards two cards.

card.name: Mons's Goblin Raiders
card.flavor: Just because they have a club doesn't mean they're organized.

card.name: Monstrous Growth
card.ability: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The nightstalkers' little game of tease-the-squirrel suddenly took an unexpected turn.

card.name: Moon Sprite
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor:
"I am that merry wanderer of the night."
—William Shakespeare,
A Midsummer Night's Dream

card.name: Muck Rats
card.flavor:
"Just as some fool said it couldn't get worse, the rats began to show up."
—Foot soldier

card.name: Natural Spring
card.ability: Target player gains 8 life.
card.flavor: The dying ask for water because they know it contains life.

card.name: Nature's Cloak
card.ability: Green creatures you control gain forestwalk until end of turn.

card.name: Nature's Lore
card.ability: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Every seed planted is another lesson the forest can teach us.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
8/1/2008 : You can find any card with the land type Forest, including Snow-covered Forest or non-Basic lands like Tropical Island, Murmuring Bosk, or Stomping Ground. You can even find a card that is a land in addition to other types, such as Dryad Arbor.

card.name: Norwood Archers
card.ability: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor:
"‘Air superiority?' Not while our archers scan the skies."
—Elvish scout

card.name: Norwood Ranger
card.flavor: Some trees bear deadly fruit.

card.name: Ogre Warrior
card.flavor: Assault and battery included.

card.name: Owl Familiar
card.ability:
Flying
When Owl Familiar enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.

card.name: Path of Peace
card.ability: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.
card.flavor:
"You could die famous or you could die old. I chose old."
—Former soldier
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If the spell fails because the target is not there or isn't legal, the owner does not gain any life.

card.name: Phantom Warrior
card.ability: Phantom Warrior is unblockable.
card.flavor: The phantom warrior comes from nowhere and returns there just as quickly.

card.name: Piracy
card.ability: Until end of turn, you may tap lands you don't control for mana. Spend this mana only to cast spells.
card.flavor: The sea gives, and the sea takes. Some just help with the taking.

card.name: Pride of Lions
card.ability: You may have Pride of Lions assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.
4/1/2008 : When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
4/1/2008 : You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
4/1/2008 : If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

card.name: Psychic Transfer
card.ability: If the difference between your life total and target player's life total is 5 or less, exchange life totals with that player.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : If one of the players has a negative life total, you use their actual life total for determining the difference. If that difference is five or less, then the other player receives the negative life total.
1/1/2011 : If an effect says that a player can't lose life, that player can't exchange life totals with a player who has a lower life total; in that case, the exchange won't happen.

card.name: Raging Goblin
card.ability: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
card.flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.

card.name: Raise Dead
card.ability: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
10/4/2004 : The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.
4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Ransack
card.ability: Look at the top five cards of target player's library. Put any number of them on the bottom of that library in any order and the rest on top of the library in any order.

card.name: Ravenous Rats
card.ability: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.

card.name: Relearn
card.ability: Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: The hardest lessons to grasp are the ones you've already learned.

card.name: Relentless Assault
card.ability: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
10/4/2004 : Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
10/4/2004 : A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
10/4/2004 : It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

card.name: Remove Soul
card.ability: Counter target creature spell.
card.flavor: When your enemies are denied soldiers, they are denied victory.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

card.name: Renewing Touch
card.ability: Shuffle any number of target creature cards from your graveyard into your library.
card.flavor: Death just encourages life the more.

card.name: Righteous Charge
card.ability: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Bravery shines brightest in a pure soul.
card.ruling: 1/24/2013 : Only creatures you control when Righteous Charge resolves will get +2/+2. Creatures that come under your control later in the turn will not.

card.name: Righteous Fury
card.ability: Destroy all tapped creatures. You gain 2 life for each creature destroyed this way.

card.name: Royal Falcon
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Hunter by instinct, weapon by training.

card.name: Royal Trooper
card.ability: Whenever Royal Trooper blocks, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Fortune does not side with the faint-hearted."
—Sophocles, Phaedra

card.name: Sacred Nectar
card.ability: You gain 4 life.
card.flavor:
"For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge, "Kubla Khan"

card.name: Scathe Zombies
card.flavor: Luckily for them, it doesn't take much brains to slaughter and maim.

card.name: Scorching Spear
card.ability: Scorching Spear deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Lift your spear as you might lift your glass, and toast your enemy.

card.name: Sea Eagle
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Where air meets water, fish meets talon.

card.name: Serpent Warrior
card.ability: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
card.flavor: A hiss before dying.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can cast this if you have less than 3 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

card.name: Shrieking Specter
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Shrieking Specter attacks, defending player discards a card.

card.name: Silverback Ape
card.flavor: His true majesty is not in his silver, but in his size.

card.name: Sleight of Hand
card.ability: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If there is only one card in your library, it goes to your hand.

card.name: Snapping Drake
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Drakes claim to be dragons—until the dragons show up.

card.name: Soul Feast
card.ability: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.
card.flavor: Evil often dines alone.

card.name: Southern Elephant
card.flavor: Neither predator nor prey, the elephant chooses its place in the battle.

card.name: Spitting Earth
card.ability: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.

card.name: Squall
card.ability: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.
card.flavor:
"To-night the winds begin to rise . . .
The rooks are blown about the skies . . . ."
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, In Memoriam

card.name: Steadfastness
card.ability: Creatures you control get +0/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Brute force wins the battles. Conviction wins the wars.

card.name: Stone Rain
card.ability: Destroy target land.

card.name: Storm Crow
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor:
Storm crow descending, winter unending.
Storm crow departing, summer is starting.

card.name: Stream of Acid
card.ability: Destroy target land or nonblack creature.

card.name: Summer Bloom
card.ability: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.
card.flavor: Summer sends its kiss with warmth and blooming life.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This spell increases the number of lands you can play in a turn. The land cards are played as you would normally play lands.

card.name: Sylvan Basilisk
card.ability: Whenever Sylvan Basilisk becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature.

card.name: Sylvan Yeti
card.ability: Sylvan Yeti's power is equal to the number of cards in your hand.
card.flavor: The deeper the wood, the greater its strength.

card.name: Thorn Elemental
card.ability: You may have Thorn Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.
4/1/2008 : When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
4/1/2008 : You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
4/1/2008 : If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

card.name: Thunder Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
When Thunder Dragon enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to each creature without flying.

card.name: Tidings
card.ability: Draw four cards.
card.flavor:
"Many wearing rapiers are afraid of goose-quills."
—William Shakespeare, Hamlet

card.name: Time Ebb
card.ability: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
card.flavor: Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.

card.name: Time Warp
card.ability: Target player takes an extra turn after this one.
card.flavor:
"Let's do it again"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

card.name: Touch of Brilliance
card.ability: Draw two cards.
card.flavor: "I don't want what I don't have. I want more of what I do have."

card.name: Trained Orgg
card.flavor: All orggs know how to kill; training teaches them what to kill.

card.name: Tremor
card.ability: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
card.flavor: One little goblin shook up the ground. When the dust cleared, no one was found.

card.name: Undo
card.ability: Return two target creatures to their owners' hands.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The two creatures may have different owners and return to their respective owner's hands.

card.name: Untamed Wilds
card.ability: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
10/15/2006 : Can fetch a Snow land.

card.name: Venerable Monk
card.ability: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
card.flavor: Age wears the flesh but galvanizes the soul.

card.name: Vengeance
card.ability: Destroy target tapped creature.
card.flavor: Bitter as wormwood, sweet as mulled wine.

card.name: Veteran Cavalier
card.ability: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
card.flavor:
Spirit is the sword and experience the sharpening stone.
—Arabian proverb

card.name: Vizzerdrix
card.flavor: Its swamp cousin may be meaner, but the vizzerdrix is much bigger.

card.name: Volcanic Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
card.flavor: Speed and fire are always a deadly combination.

card.name: Volcanic Hammer
card.ability: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Fire finds its form in the heat of the forge.

card.name: Water Elemental
card.flavor:
The water that a ship sails on is the same water that swallows it up.
—Chinese proverb

card.name: Whiptail Wurm
card.flavor: It's hard to say for certain which end is more dangerous.

card.name: Whirlwind
card.ability: Destroy all creatures with flying.

card.name: Wicked Pact
card.ability: Destroy two target nonblack creatures. You lose 5 life.

card.name: Wild Griffin
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Two little goblins, out in the sun. Down came a griffin, and then there was one.

card.name: Wild Ox
card.ability: Swampwalk
card.flavor: It has the run of the swamps, and it knows it.

card.name: Willow Elf
card.flavor: The forest lives in the elf as the elf lives in the forest.

card.name: Wind Drake
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: "No bird soars too high, if he soars with his own wings."William Blake, The Marriage of Heaven and Hell

card.name: Wind Sail
card.ability: One or two target creatures gain flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: It pays to be at home both on the sea and in the sky.

card.name: Wood Elves
card.ability: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
